text: Rear Admiral George Mphafi is a South African Navy officer, serving as Chief Director Operations Development at the Joint Operations Division.http://www.defenceweb.co.za/index.php?option=com_content&view;=article&id;=10993:promotions- and-transfers-major-generalrear-admiral&catid;=111:sa-defence&Itemid;=242 He was the Officer Commanding of the South African Naval College until 2004.http://www.iol.co.za/news/south-africa/another-first-for-the-naval- college-1.205935#.VGIN7clptNE He then served as Chief of Fleet Staff at Fleet Command before being appointed as Chief of Defence Foreign Relations with effect from 1 November 2004.http://www.dcc.mil.za/bulletins/Files/2004/83bulletin2004.htm This was followed by a stint as Defence Attache in Washington He served as Chief of Navy Staffhttp://ports.co.za/news/news_2010_12_08_01.php until assuming his current position in November 2010.http://www.defenceweb.co.za/index.php?option=com_content&view;=article&id;=10993:promotions- and-transfers-major-generalrear-admiral&catid;=111:sa-defence&Itemid;=242 ==Awards and honours== * * * * * * x20px Conspicuous Service Medal He was awarded the Conspicuous Service Medal by the New York National Guard.http://dmna.ny.gov/spp/?id=events&year;=2011#mphafi_csm ==References== Category:Living people Category:South African admirals Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: George Mphafi
